sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Severall informations and examinations taken concerning Lieutenant Colonell Iohn Lilburn, shewing his apostacy to the party of Charles Stuart: and what his intentions are in coming over into England out of Flanders. Berkenhead, Isaac.
[2], 14 p.
Printed by H. Hills, and for G. Calvert and T. Brewster, and are to be sold at the Black-spread Eagle and the three Bibles at and near the west-end of Pauls, London, : 1653.
Five testimonies signed by Isaac Berkenhead, John Tytus, John Bartlet, Richard Foot, and John Staplehill. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July 13". Reproductions of the originals in the University of Illinois Library (Early English books 1241:6) and the British Library (Thomason Tracts E.705[14]).
=======
Severall informations and examinations taken concerning Lieutenant Colonell Iohn Lilburn, shewing his apostacy to the party of Charles Stuart: and what his intentions are in coming over into England out of Flanders. Berkenhead, Isaac.
[2], 14 p.
Printed by H. Hills, and for G. Calvert and T. Brewster, and are to be sold at the Black-spread Eagle and the three Bibles at and near the west-end of Pauls, London, : 1653.
Five testimonies signed by Isaac Berkenhead, John Tytus, John Bartlet, Richard Foot, and John Staplehill. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July 13". Reproductions of the originals in the University of Illinois Library (Early English books 1241:6) and the British Library (Thomason Tracts E.705[14]).
